class TimePickerBox

Detailed Description

The callback interface used to indicate the user is done filling in the time (they clicked on the 'Set' button).

The following example demonstrates how to use the IDialogOnTimeSetListener. 

  //You need implement your owner OnTimeSet Listener for TimePickerBox
  class MyDialogOnTimeSetListener : gaia::core::IDialogOnTimeSetListener {
    public:
      MyDialogOnTimeSetListener();
      virtual ~MyDialogOnTimeSetListener();
      void onTimeSet(int32_t hourOfDay, int32_t minute);
  };

  void MyDialogOnTimeSetListener::onTimeSet(int32_t hourOfDay, int32_t minute) {
    //When TimePickerBox time is set, it will notify.
    //Your Implementation
  }

  //In your TimePickerBox, just register the callback by registerOnTimeSetListener
  gaia::core::TimePickerBox* timeBox = new gaia::core::TimePickerBox(Page);
  MyDialogOnTimeSetListener* listener = new MyDialogOnTimeSetListener();
  if (listener == NULL) {
    //DialogOnTimeSetListener create failure!!
    return;
  }

  if (timeBox != NULL) {
    timeBox->registerOnTimeSetListener(listener);
  }
